subject: Math
analogy: Think of a soccer game. If you score 7 out of 10 shots, that’s 70%! Percentages show how many parts out of 100 you’ve got.

analogy: Think of percentages like your phone’s battery. If it’s at 75%, you’ve used 75 out of 100 parts of its power!

analogy: Think of percentages as a music streaming playlist. If 70% of your playlist is hip-hop, 70 out of 100 songs are hip-hop tracks.

subject: Reading
analogy: The main idea is like the biggest toy in your toy box. It’s the most important part of the story that everything else connects to!

analogy: The main idea is like the star player on a soccer team. It’s the biggest, most important part that the whole story focuses on!

analogy: The main idea is like the core message of a group chat. It’s the big point everyone’s talking about, even with lots of side comments!

analogy: A metaphor is like saying a teddy bear is a cuddly cloud. It’s not really a cloud, but it feels soft and cozy like one!

analogy: A metaphor is like calling your soccer teammate a 'lion' because they’re fierce and strong, comparing without using 'like' or 'as.'
